alert.note: Alert for Northern Clearwater Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 19 at 2:02PM MST until February 21 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 4 AM PST TUESDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH LATE TUESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Additional snow accumulations of 10 to 15 inches for elevations above 3500 feet, 4 to 6 inches down to 2500 feet including Pierce. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 7 to 12 inches above 2000 feet with higher amounts in the mountains. 1 to 4 inches below 2000 feet. Winds could gust as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Elk River, Highway 11 Pierce to Headquarters, and Pierce. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 4 PM Sunday to 4 AM PST Tuesday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from late Monday night through late Tuesday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The cold wind chills as low as 15 below zero could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
